intro: Grammosciadium macrodon, commonly known as the giant scurfpea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and compound leaves with a distinctive, hairy texture. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has a taproot system that helps it survive in dry conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated pods and are often dispersed by wind. Grammosciadium macrodon is typically found in open woods, prairies, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
